Task.TaskDescription: Problem: When admitted to the hospital, the glucose level in the patient's blood was 10 units, NEWLINE which is too low. Thus, an IV line was started which adds 3 units per hour to the blood. Even NEWLINE though the patient is lying still on the bed, the body burns up some glucose. The amount of NEWLINE glucose the body removes from the blood each hour is 2% of the glucose in the blood at that time. NEWLINE So after the first hour, the glucose levels in the patient's blood was 12.74 units. NEWLINE NEWLINE Goal: Graph the glucose level in the blood for 24 hours.
Task.ShortDescription:
The amount of glucose in the blood at the end of the hour = 
 the amount of glucose in the blood at the end of the previous hour 
 + the amount of glucose added to the blood this hour 
 - the amount of glucose removed from the blood this hour. 
 Initially, the amount of glucose in the blood is 10. 
the amount of glucose added to the blood each hour is given at 3. 
the amount of glucose removed from the blood each hour = 
 the amount of glucose in the blood at the beginning of the hour 
 * the proportion of glucose removed from the blood during the hour. 
the proportion of glucose removed from the blood during the hour is given at 0.02.
